spec.name: Ould el Hamra
spec.bio: Ould el Hamra is primarily known through the mosque bearing his name, the Ould el-Hamra Mosque in Casablanca. While the mosque's construction began during the reign of 'Alawi Sultan Muhammad bin 'Abdallah (1757-1790), specifically in the latter half of the 18th century, information about a specific person named 'Ould el Hamra' who built it is scarce in readily available historical records. The mosque itself is a significant example of 18th-century religious architecture in Morocco and one of the few surviving structures from Sultan Muhammad bin 'Abdallah's time in the old medina of Casablanca.

timeline.title: Mosque Construction Initiated
timeline.description: Construction of the Ould el-Hamra Mosque in Casablanca began during the reign of Sultan Muhammad bin 'Abdallah (1757-1790).

timeline.title: Minaret Construction
timeline.description: The minaret of the Ould el-Hamra Mosque was constructed after the death of Sultan Muhammad bin 'Abdallah.
